INTERSHOP IOM 5.2.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision bd4d2c7652e75623a5c8fba9fd7f8256a8bed6e3)

Table oms.CommunicationPartnerDO

Relations between two communication partners between which a transmission should be executed.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id bigint PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL  
DecisionBeanDefDO decisionBeanDefRef integer The implementation that handles partner-related decisions for communication to external applications. 
splitTransmission boolean NOT_NULL false Whether the order can be split into one single transmission per order position. 
CommunicationDO communicationRef bigint NOT_NULL The relation of communication properties that is used by the communication partners. 
PartnerReferrerDO receivingPartnerReferrerRef bigint The communication partner that is receiving the message. 
PartnerReferrerDO sendingPartnerReferrerRef bigint The communication partner that is sending the message. 
maxNoOfRetries integer NOT_NULL 12 Maximum number of retries to send the transmission after the first attempt failed. If NULL, default is 12. 
retryDelay varchar(50) NOT_NULL '30m'::character varying Duration before the next try to transmit. If NULL, default is "30m". Format: d(ay) h(our) m(inute) s(second) e.g.: "1h30m" 
MergeTypeDefDO mergeTypeDefRef integer Deprecated 
splitTransmissionPerSupplier boolean NOT_NULL true Forces transmissions to be split per suppliers. This flag is only relevant when neither the sender nor the reiceiver is a supplier. 

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.
